comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Franz von Papen (29 October 1879 – 2 May 1969) was a German nobleman, General Staff officer and politician. He served as Chancellor of Germany in 1932 and as Vice-Chancellor under Adolf Hitler in 1933–1934. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_von_Papen In December 1915, Wilson demanded the recall of Franz von Papen, at that time military attaché to the German Ambassador to the United States, and the German naval attaché Karl Boy-Ed, see New-York tribune., December 04, 1915, Image 1 Karl Boy-Ed:
